paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patients with ovarian cancer (three patients aged 50, 59 and 70 years at the onset of disease) represented only 6% of all breast and ovarian cancer cases in the families bearing the mutation c.7806-2A > G.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was detected in 11 families.
key_quotes: The average age of the patients at the onset of breast cancer was 50.9 years.
Breast cancer was in 40% of cases discovered before the age of 50.

variants.additional_notes: The average age of the patients at the onset of breast cancer in these families was 45.5 years.
key_quotes: In 72% of cases, breast cancer was discovered before the age of 50 years.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patients with ovarian cancer (two patients aged 40 and 52 years at the onset of the disease) represented 29% of all breast and ovarian cancer cases in these families.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is located in the 'ovarian cluster region' of BRCA2 gene.
key_quotes: The average age of the patients at the onset of breast cancer was 52.2 years.
In 66% of cases, breast cancer was detected before the age of 50 years.
